newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends steady in kerb, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends steady in kerb, seen stable.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed steady at 41.20 to the dollar in kerb market on Monday amid a rising demand for the U.S. currency, and is likely to open stable on Tuesday, dealers said.
"The supply and demand for dollars are quite steady at the moment," one dealer said, adding that the rupee might open around similar levels on Tuesday.

The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 2.90 percent from Saturday's close at 3.0 percent. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
